content: or sell any items made from this pattern but would love if you could credit me as a designer additional information pattern is written in us crochet terms never hesitate to contact me through my instagram account or etsy shop and i will do my best to help you think about the environment and don t print out enjoy this pattern with love halime head work with yarn color a round 1 6 single_crochet in a magic_ring 6 round 2 increase x 6 12 round 3 1 single_crochet increase x 6 18 round 4 1 single_crochet increase 2 single_crochet x 5 increase 1 single_crochet 24 round 5 3 single_crochet increase x 6 30 round 6 2 single_crochet increase 4 single_crochet x 5 increase 2 single_crochet 36 round 7 5 single_crochet increase x 6 42 round 8 42 single_crochet 42 round 9 3 single_crochet increase 6 single_crochet x 5 increase 3 single_crochet 48 round 10-13 48 single_crochet 4 rounds 48 round 14 15 single_crochet increase x 3 51 round 15 8 single_crochet increase 16 single_crochet increase x 2 8 single_crochet 54 round 16-18 54 single_crochet 3 rounds 54 place the security eyes between round 13 and 14 with 7 stitches between the eyes use 7 mm security eyes if using 2 0 mm hook otherwise use what fits the gauge best round 19 7 single_crochet decrease x 6 48 round 20 48 single_crochet 48 round 21 3 single_crochet decrease 6 single_crochet decrease x 5 3 single_crochet 42 round 22 5 single_crochet decrease x 6 36 round 23 2 single_crochet decrease 4 single_crochet decrease x 5 2 single_crochet 30 round 24 3 single_crochet decrease x 6 24 stuff the head with filling and keep doing as you go round 25 2 single_crochet decrease x 6 18 round 26 1 single_crochet decrease x 6 12 round 27 decrease x 6 6 fasten_off 3 muzzle work with yarn color b do not stuff round 4 1 single_crochet decrease x 4 8 round 5 decrease x 4 4 first part fasten_off and leave a long yarn tail round 1 6 single_crochet in a magic_ring 6 weave the yarn tail through the front round 2 6 single_crochet 6 loops of each stitch and pull it tight to fasten_off close rest of the yarn tail will be used to sew the muzzle to the head muzzle round 1 6 single_crochet in a magic_ring 6 embroidery round 2 6 single_crochet 6 take a piece of yarn color c and round 3 2 single_crochet take the first part and embroider the nose as below picture continue on that one 6 single_crochet now go back to the muzzle 4 single_crochet 12 round 3 make 2 single_crochet and then con- round 3 is now finished and both when you embroider the pink nose draw the yarn many times through tinue crochet on the first part parts are combined insert your needle at round 3 between the place where you insert the the two pieces in the bottom needle make it thick
